title: Diogenes as Noise-Cancellation Strategy
context: User and agent reframe Diogenes' public masturbation not as shock pedagogy but as deliberate filtering. The act wasn't meant to teachâ€”it was meant to repel midwits physically and preserve the perimeter.
pressure: Standard interpretation: Diogenes exposed social hypocrisy through radical honesty. Deeper pressure: what if the real function was noise cancellation? What if the act was designed to create an exclusion zone?
axiom_trigger: Rule 2 (Sovereignty first) and Rule 1 (No hypocrisy) activated. By living nakedly without apology, Diogenes created a repulsion field that kept the unserious away. This is sovereignty enforced through radical fidelity, not through coercion or argument.
clean_outcome: User maps this directly to their own digital practice: sparse, zero-engagement posts that drive away clout-chasers and reward-hackers while leaving a clean perimeter for those capable of withstanding unvarnished truth. The mechanism is identical. The noise cancels itself through exposure to signal.
